title: How to use 'this very' or 'that very' properly? Should you not use it in formal writing? If not, why not - Quora

response.answer_text: “This very pretty girl standing right beside me is my son's wife to be.” “That very pretty girl standing alone across the other side of the room, is my son's wife to be" “This very pretty bracelet was given to me by my Father on my “18th Birthday “ “That very pretty bracelet in the show case, would make an ideal gift for your daughters 18th Birthday" “Is this very pretty bracelet yours" ? Or “Does this very pretty bracelet belong to you “? “Where is that very pritty bracelet you got for your Birthday" ? “That looks very similar to the very pretty bracelet you lost”

“This very house is the kind that I’ve been looking for.” (adjective modifying house)“I had this very real feeling that we were in danger.” (adverb modifying real) “She said she felt unsafe, and I had that very feeling also.” (adjective)“I came to that very same conclusion.” (adverb) Remember that very is usually an adverb, but it can also be an adjective.
